markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Flintlock Musket](/Weapons.aspx?ID=521)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concussive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=401" />
<trait label="Fatal d10" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=597" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 50

**Favored Weapon** [Cixyron](/Deities.aspx?ID=417)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 5 gp

**Damage** 1d6 P

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 2

**Range** 70 ft.

**Reload** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Ranged

**Category** Simple

**Group** [Firearm](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=16)
</row>

**Ammunition** [Firearm Ammunition (10 rounds)](/Weapons.aspx?ID=211)

</column>

---

The flintlock musket includes an external firing mechanism and an efficient and relatively compact frame. Though lacking the range and firing power of the [arquebus](/Weapons.aspx?ID=195), the flintlock musket is popular among civilians for its ease of use.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-16" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Musket Staff of Force](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3587), [Musket Staff of the Void](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3588)
name: Flintlock Musket
